abbrkey.$<...>$: brackets enclosing the list of semantic arguments of a predicate
abbrkey.*: element in the name of the predicate of a lexeme with a selected semantically light element (e.g., a preposition)
abbrkey.=c: symbol in a constraint equation: constrained to be equal to
abbrkey.INESS: Infrastructure for the exploration of syntax and semantics
abbrkey.XLE: the development platform Xerox Linguistic Environment
abbrkey.\\#: element in the name of the predicate of a lexeme with a selected semantically heavy element (e.g., a noun, forming an idiom)
abbrkey.\\%FN: variable over predicate names in a lexical template
abbrkey.\\char`~: negation in an equation defining f-structure
abbrkey.↑: metavariable in an equation, referring to the f-structure of the node immediately dominating the node to which the equation is annotated
abbrkey.↓: metavariable in an equation, referring to the f-structure of the node to which the equation is annotated

she

thought

on

bus-{\definite}.{\sg}

trs: She was thinking (while) on the bus./She thought about the bus.
